review_title: Being a tutor was so much fun
pros: You can do your homework when there is a lull. Awesome atmosphere
cons: I don't really have any cons.

pros:
Great Benefits, paid holidays, lots of vacation and sick time
Relatively secure employment compared to commercial industries
Unions for classified and faculty make it difficult to be fired, management is not as lucky
cons:
Top leadership has specific goals and will work employees to death to reach those goals. These goals are often sudden random thoughts that are not planned strategically or with efficiency in mind. We are not given the resources (people, time, technology, budget) to make these things happen in a short amount of time at a ridiculously professional (not education) standard and it causes a lot of stress for those that have to make it happen.

People are often expected to work even during their time off. If you are a classified employee, read your contract and make sure to push back when BC administration pushes management to contact you after hours, on the weekends, when you are sick, and during vacations. Management doesn't have that luxury and end up working with no days off, getting calls before 5AM, and being expected to work during their vacation. There is no respect for a work/life balance, no forethought or planning to make the business side of the school more efficient. There is also no concern for the employees and you have to protect yourself.

Additionally, many of the job descriptions are written so that they can require you to have too wide of a range of skills. These descriptions were written so that they could use them in a wide array of jobs. The issue is that they are now used to make one person do all of the work that is in the description which was written before each of those duties became so extensive that they each need to be their own job. The procedure for updating a job description only lends itself to adding duties that may not have been listed before. It does not take into account that the description is no longer industry standard, that it was written poorly, or that the duties require different, separate, skill sets.

While these job descriptions are written so broadly that they encompass too many skill sets, when hiring, skills of the applicants are often ignored. This is in part due to no one having that wide of a skill set and if they did, they could make much more money at a larger corporation. The other part is that nepotism is rampant and hiring committees, used to make the hiring process fair, are often pressured to hire specific people rather than the best qualified due to favoritism and promises made by administration. Of course, there is nothing ever in writing about this making it hard to prove other than performance of the candidates. The leadership does not show integrity nor morals.

pros: Great Environment! Friendly Staff! and amazing student support programs. The college is clearly on the up and up.

review_title: Treats Adjuncts Poorly...Okay if you're full time
pros: Decent pay for part-time adjuncts...for the time they put in on campus
cons:
1) As is usual for adjuncts on college campuses, no pay for the vast amount of time spent outside of class grading, preparing lectures, etc. This isn't specific to BC, but they are as guilty of it as other colleges and universities.
2) Terrible bureaucratic morass.   Even though I was currently teaching classes, was disqualified from applying for full-time position because of THEIR error.

pros: Take a job as a tutor and you can functionally get paid to do your own homework. The job even when you are helping out is easy and can be fun if you like math or the subject you are teaching.
cons: Kids were not keeping appointments, the pay is minimum wage and capped at 19 hours a week. What is worse is that you must be taking at least 6 units to work. Only do this as a college job to earn extra money.

job_title: Supplemental Instruction Leader in Bakersfield, CA
pros: It is a great way to make extra money while getting a degree. You also keep the things you are tutoring fresh in your mind for other classes. It helps you get into the work environment mode before graduating.
cons: If you have a background it will take some work to get to be an employee. They will question and make you feel horrible about your past and question if you can get a job after you get a degree. just keep fighting.
